page.title: 07POSTAL SERVICE IN FERNESS
page.content: There has been a post office at Ferness since the village was built in the mid 1800's. The mail used to be brought to Ferness by horse and cart from Dunphail where it met the train on the Forres/Grantown on Spey line. Today it comes by postbus from Nairn. This service began in 1973, bringing mail to and collecting it from Glenferness post office. The postbus can carry 11 passengers who are able to spend 2 hours in Nairn between the two daily rounds. From Ferness the mail is delivered to the households by van. It takes the postman approx. 5 hours to complete his round. Some houses are remote and in winter it is often impossible to reach them for several days.
